result.query:
Please find the name of the catalyst and co-catalyst name from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
Please only generate the name of the catalyst and nothing else. Such as TiO2. ZrO2 or Ag, etc.
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.
catalyst: XXX
co_catalyst: XXX

and an electrolyte (0.5 M Na 2 SO 4 aqueous solution at pH 7).A Scion 456 gas chromatograph (GC) equipped with a flame ionization detector (FID) using a methanizer and a GC9790 Plus gas chromatograph (GC) equipped with a TCD were utilized to analyze the gas products. 2.4.Photoreduction Procedure.The photocatalytic CO 2 reduction reaction was evaluated in an airtight glass reactor with a quartz top cap and a gas sampling port.Typically, 10 mg of photocatalyst, 45 mg of bipyridine (bpy), 60 L of CoCl 2

Photocatalytic conversion of CO 2 into fuel and value-added chemicals as a promising method has been applied recently to ease energy-or environment-related crises.Herein, we construct an In 2 S 3 NH 2 -MIL-68(In) In 2 S 3 (denoted as SMS(In)) sandwich homologous heterojunction via a controllable in situ metal-organic frameworks (MOF) sulfuration process.The improved photoreduction activity mainly lies in the effective charge transfer and separation through a homogeneous interface, enhanced CO 2 adsorption

reaction (Figure 2c, columns 2 and 4).Remarkably, the photocatalytic performance dropped sharply in the absence of 2c, column 3). 40,43MS(In)-7 was used for consecutive four runs without a significant loss of activity, indicating excellent reusability and stability (Figure 2b). 3.3.Mechanism of Photocatalytic Enhancement.To elucidate the reasons for the excellent photocatalytic CO 2 reduction over SMS(In)-7, the adsorption capacity of CO 2 was first investigated.As shown in Figure 2d, with a high surface

electrons and holes.The photocatalytic mechanism is proposed in Scheme 1, where the electrons in the valence band (VB 1.02eV) were initially excited and migrated to the conduction band (CB -0.63eV) in In 2 S 3 .Supported by potential difference, the electrons in the conduction band (CB) of In 2 S 3 subsequently transferred to the conduction band (CB -0.60 eV) of NH 2 -MIL-68(In).Then, Co II (bpy) 3 2 (E(Co(bpy) 3 2 ) -0.526eV vs NHE, pH 7, Figure S5) accepted the excited electrons from NH 2 -MIL-68(In) to

result.query:
Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.
Please only select the generation from the provided possible choices.
Possible Choices:
Light_source: ['UV', 'Solar', 'UV-Vis', 'Monochromatic', 'Solar Simulator']
Lamp: ['Fluorescent', 'Mercury', 'Halogen', 'Mercury-Xenon', 'LED', 'Tungsten', 'Xenon', 'Tungsten-Halide', 'Solar Simulator']
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
Light_source: XXX
Lamp: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: (bpy), 60 L of CoCl 2 aqueous solution (54.6 mM), and 6 mL of the mixed reaction solution (V CH 3 CN V TEOA 4:1) were mixed in a reactor.Then, the reactor was evacuated, and was purged with high purity CO 2 at a partial pressure of 0.1 MPa.This process was carried out several times to ensure that the reactor was full of pure CO 2 .The solution was irradiated with a 300 W xenon lamp (420 nm) with 400 mW cm -2 of light intensity (10.5 cm distance from the reaction solution).During irradiation, the reaction

UV-vis diffused reflectance spectra (DRS) was measured by a UV-vis spectrophotometer (U-3900, HITACHI, Japan).The steadystate and transient fluorescence was carried out by a fluorescence spectrometer (FLS 980, Edinburgh, England) coupled with a time-correlated single photocounting system.The Mott-Schottky curves were obtained on an electrochemical workstation (CHI660D) with a three-electrode cell with Pt as a counter electrode, AgAgCl as a reference electrode, and an electrolyte (0.5

and an electrolyte (0.5 M Na 2 SO 4 aqueous solution at pH 7).A Scion 456 gas chromatograph (GC) equipped with a flame ionization detector (FID) using a methanizer and a GC9790 Plus gas chromatograph (GC) equipped with a TCD were utilized to analyze the gas products. 2.4.Photoreduction Procedure.The photocatalytic CO 2 reduction reaction was evaluated in an airtight glass reactor with a quartz top cap and a gas sampling port.Typically, 10 mg of photocatalyst, 45 mg of bipyridine (bpy), 60 L of CoCl 2

enhanced CO 2 adsorption and mass transfer, and plentiful reactive sites.Benefiting from this unique hollow homologous heterojunction, SMS(In)-7 obtains a CO generation rate as high as 11.23 mol g -1 h -1 with visible-light irradiation, nearly 3 times enhancement over that of pure MOF-derived In 2 S 3 .This work provides a novel insight into the utilization of MOF-based platform for an efficient atomically heterojunction design.

, CdS, and ZnO.Other potential reduction products such as HCOOH, CH 3 OH, and CH 4 were not detected by 1 H NMR (Figure S3) and GC. Almost no CO was produced in the control experiment under an argon atmosphere, indicating that CO 2 rather than the catalyst or solvent was the carbon source for CO (Figure 2c, column 5).Besides, no obvious CO could be detected while the reaction was performed without light irradiation or a photocatalyst, demonstrating that it was a photoinduced reaction (Figure 2c, columns 2

Photocatalytic conversion of CO 2 into fuel and value-added chemicals as a promising method has been applied recently to ease energy-or environment-related crises.Herein, we construct an In 2 S 3 NH 2 -MIL-68(In) In 2 S 3 (denoted as SMS(In)) sandwich homologous heterojunction via a controllable in situ metal-organic frameworks (MOF) sulfuration process.The improved photoreduction activity mainly lies in the effective charge transfer and separation through a homogeneous interface, enhanced CO 2 adsorption

(bpy), 60 L of CoCl 2 aqueous solution (54.6 mM), and 6 mL of the mixed reaction solution (V CH 3 CN V TEOA 4:1) were mixed in a reactor.Then, the reactor was evacuated, and was purged with high purity CO 2 at a partial pressure of 0.1 MPa.This process was carried out several times to ensure that the reactor was full of pure CO 2 .The solution was irradiated with a 300 W xenon lamp (420 nm) with 400 mW cm -2 of light intensity (10.5 cm distance from the reaction solution).During irradiation, the reaction

enhanced CO 2 adsorption and mass transfer, and plentiful reactive sites.Benefiting from this unique hollow homologous heterojunction, SMS(In)-7 obtains a CO generation rate as high as 11.23 mol g -1 h -1 with visible-light irradiation, nearly 3 times enhancement over that of pure MOF-derived In 2 S 3 .This work provides a novel insight into the utilization of MOF-based platform for an efficient atomically heterojunction design.
